title: I never understood why top laners hated jayce
body:
Then after dumpstering my laner they decided to swap, we were roughly even I had gunblade as kat and he had youmous.
 First of all he empowered qs me for half my hp. Like what the fuck. Then he goes into melee and starts hitting me??? Like who thought " A ranged AND melee champion in one" was ever a good idea.

replies.body: Its the knock-back in melee form that also has a slow that is triggering. Just when you think you finally got him.. yuh dont.

He beats ranged in ranged, and he beats melee in melee. 

That’s what everyone hates about him. Jayce and Caitlyn are the only champions in the game that just win lane by default. 

ANd Jayce “falls off” ONLY against tanks, against anyone else he still fucks em up.

Cait doesn't really win by default tho? O_O

I´ve beaten several good ones in lane while playing champs like Varus,  MF (even before OP hit), ashe and Jinx, mainly Ashe though.

Not anymore, but for the longest time she did. They gutted the ever living shit out of Cait. 

Ashe is actually a “soft counter” to Cait because she can match push and poke with W. But between players of equal skill she still doesn’t WIN lane. She just has a good ult to set up ganks/for her support, which punished Cait heavily for overextending as she does.

But with no jungler/support in the equation Cait still wins.

Same thing with Jayce, he’s easy as shit to shut down via camping him, but it sucks to be in a lane where only your jungler can save you.
His Q has the slow, his knock back does not. He's still cancer.
I know, its the combination he uses when he is in trouble, and because the slow is so strong .. For 2s..combo'd with the knock back.. It's pretty impossible to catch up.
You should be able to dodge the jayce e q so easily as kata
It flies really fast? Who has that kind of reaction time in fog of war
Probably a lot of assassin mains can.  It's just a matter of whether or not you considered the possibility of him coming.

Yeah, E Q anyone can dodge cause it's obvious and clunky, but even in silver half decent jayce players  QE and if you aren't already moving that shit hits most of the time. dunno what they're talking about
The key thing to note here is that they were playing Kat.  If they reacted fast enough, they could just E out of the way.

Isn't Jayce E Q about the fastest skillshot in the game? Sure it requires 2 skills, but decent Jayces leave almost no reaction time. Also, the heavy splash area means you have to be weary of sitting in your minions as well, despite the minions being your most reliable method of avoiding such skillshots in the first place. And we've only talked about 2 of 6 (7? 8?) skills on his kit.

By this logic, Kat should be invulnerable in the League of Skillshots.
Shun Po has no travel time, the speed of the projectile is irrelevant, she literally instant transmissions away.

Again, by this logic, Kat would be invulnerable in the League of Skillshots. However, not only are there methods of avoiding instant dodge altogether, like baiting out the cooldown, but the QE combo on Jayce is amongst the easiest skillshots to land in the game with its incredible speed and massive landing AoE. It also accounts for a very small chunk of his kit, 1/4 of it disregarding the certain speed boost he gets for using his QE combo in the first place. It's one thing to downplay the power of QE, but to call it an easy dodge is laughable on such an overloaded kit.

It's not easy to dodge for most champions, but it should be relatively easy for Kat.  Yes you can bait her E cooldown, but that is not what happened in this situation.  He simply failed to react in time.

This is the League of Skillshots, and the League of Mobility. Most champions have high amounts of mobility, and regardless, Kat can dodge 1 of almost any champion's abilities. Jayce is not special in that regard, except that his ability *is actually harder to time*, and Kat actually is special in that her mobility is bound to unit or dagger locations. 1 hop means jack when others have far stronger evasion: {{champion:60}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:114}} . And Jayce's isn't even like an ultimate dodge, either, it's 2 of his 8 skills. If Kat is Jayce's counter, then she's even more of a counter to any champion with a dodgeable ultimate, which is a very heavy amount of them.

for godssakes, *Jayce counters Katarina*. Jayce is [Katarina's 3rd hardest counter](http://champion.gg/champion/Katarina/Middle?league=). If we were talking Faker here, maybe, but even that is questionable.

Nobody said Katarina counters Jayce. {{sticker:sg-lulu}} 

I just said she could dodge his EQ/QE easier than most champs and would have been able to if she had prepared herself.

I can't tell whether you do play the game, if you rely on scripts to do all your playing, or are trolling a hypothetical situation. Either way, you have a non-realistic view on Jayce's threat zone and Katarina's defensive prowess, or are again throwing up a hypothetical, purposely ignoring both. Soraka *can* be a kill threat. However, the majority of players find they lack the general capability compared to the rest of the League. Katarina *can* dodge the game's fastest skillshot by spending her defensive cooldowns, if sensed quick enough. But that is not Katarina exclusive, and should never have been entertained as such.

As I've mentioned, she's hard countered against Jayce for a reason, and it's not because she's been dodging everything he's been throwing at her. If anything, these "slick dodges" have put her in a rut to then try to face Jayce with his other 6 skills, and you've only created a scenario where she dodges one skill only to be left helpless to die regardless. We shouldn't be making a point by saying "... if only he missed his Q...". He didn't, Kat died, and that's the end. Any further discussion suggests a lack of skill existed within the situation, and that simply is not the case.
